intro: Stoibrax didymum, commonly known as the twin-leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in coastal or mountainous regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
